title: Technical Documentation
content:
# Architecture Overview

The Cognito Chatbot App uses a modern serverless architecture:

## Frontend
- Next.js with server-side rendering (SSR)
- JavaScript for application code
- AWS Amplify Gen 2 libraries for authentication and API integration
- Server-side middleware for authentication and authorization checks
- Responsive design for multiple screen sizes

## Backend
- AWS Lambda functions written in JavaScript
- API Gateway for REST API endpoints
- Cognito authorizer for API security
- TypeScript for CDK infrastructure code

## Authentication & Authorization
- AWS Cognito User Pools with custom attributes
- Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) using custom:role attribute
- JWT tokens for session management
- Server-side token validation on every request

## Data Storage
- Amazon S3 for knowledge base documents
- Versioning enabled for document history
- Encryption at rest for security

## AI/ML
- Amazon Bedrock for natural language processing
- Claude 3 Sonnet model recommended
- Context-aware responses using RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation)

## Security Features
- HTTPS for all communications
- Password policies enforced by Cognito
- Email verification required
- Rate limiting and throttling on APIs
- Least privilege IAM roles
- Input validation and sanitization

## Deployment
- AWS Amplify Gen 2 for infrastructure as code
- CDK for resource definitions
- Automatic scaling for Lambda and API Gateway
- Environment-specific configurations

## Performance
- Lambda cold start optimization
- API response caching
- Efficient S3 document retrieval
- CloudWatch monitoring and metrics
